# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    col = lowercase(strip(col))
    col = replace(col, r"[-\s]+" => "_")
    clean_column
end
```

This function, `clean_column`, accepts a single argument of `AbstractString` type, which represents the column name. It first lowers the case of the string using `lowercase()`, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip()`. Lastly, it uses the `replace()` function with a regular expression to replace any multiple occurrences of whitespaces or hyphens with a single underscore. The resulting cleaned column name is returned as the function output.
